    Returns the goodness of fit of a regression model against two variables, x and y using the model's residualSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarVector, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction) and the dependent variable's totalSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarFunction)

  • Method Details

    • sum

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction sum​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector)
      Function to calculate the sum of all values in a scalar data sequence 

               Σy = y1 + y2...+ yn

      Parameters:
      vector - the scalar vector containing the values to sum
      Returns:
      a function to calculate the sum of all values. The function returns a Scalar value

    • sum

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction sum​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, String variable)
      Function to calculate the sum of all values in a scalar data sequence 

               Σy = y1 + y2...+ yn

      Parameters:
      vector - the scalar vector containing the values to sum
      variable - the variable to assign to this function
      Returns:
      a function to calculate the sum of all values. The function returns a Scalar value

    • mean

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction mean​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector)
      Function to calculate the mean of all values in a scalar data sequence 

               ȳ = Σy / ny

      Parameters:
      vector - vector the scalar vector containing the values to average
      Returns:
      a function to compute the mean from all values in a scalar data sequence. The function returns a Scalar value

    • mean

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction mean​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, String variable)
      Function to calculate the mean of all values in a scalar data sequence 

               ȳ = Σy / ny

      Parameters:
      vector - vector the scalar vector containing the values to average
      variable - the variable to assign to the function
      Returns:
      a function to compute the mean from all values in a scalar data sequence. The function returns a Scalar value

      Return the function to compute the median value from a given sample population
      Parameters:
      vector - the population data
      Returns:
      The equation that will compute the median coefficient

      The equation that will compute the median coefficient

    • variance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction variance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector)
      Return the function to compute the variance from a data set. The algorithm is the sum of the squares of the deviations of each item from the data set's mean. 
              σ2y = Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vector - the population data
      Returns:
      the equation to compute the variance

    • variance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction variance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, String variable)
      Return the function to compute the variance from a data set. The algorithm is the sum of the squares of the deviations of each item from the data set's mean. 
              σ2y = Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vector - the population data
      variable - the variable to assign to the function
      Returns:
      the equation to compute the variance

    • variance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction variance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanFunction)
      Return the function to compute the variance from a data set. The algorithm is the sum of the squares of the deviations of each item from the data set's mean. 
              σ2y = Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vector - the population data
      meanFunction - the function reference for the mean of this vector
      Returns:
      the equation to compute the variance

    • variance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction variance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanFunction, String variable)
      Return the function to compute the variance from a data set. The algorithm is the sum of the squares of the deviations of each item from the data set's mean. 
              σ2y = Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vector - the population data
      meanFunction - the function reference for the mean of this vector
      variable - the variable to assign to this function
      Returns:
      the equation to compute the variance

    • standardDeviation

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction standardDeviation​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction varianceFunction)
      Return the equation to compute the standard deviation from a sample population 
      
     σy = √(Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1))

     or simply, the square root of the variance function

     √σ2y
      Parameters:
      varianceFunction - the Scalar coefficient value computed from the variance(ScalarVector) function
      Returns:
      the equation to compute standard deviation

    • standardDeviation

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction standardDeviation​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction varianceFunction, String variable)
      Return the equation to compute the standard deviation from a sample population 
      
     σy = √(Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1))

     or simply, the square root of the variance function

     √σ2y
      Parameters:
      varianceFunction - the Scalar coefficient value computed from the variance(ScalarVector) function
      variable - the variable assign to the function
      Returns:
      the equation to compute standard deviation

    • standardDeviation

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction standardDeviation​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorParameter)
      Return the equation to compute the standard deviation from a sample population 
      
     σy = √(Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1))

     or simply, the square root of the variance function

     √σ2y
      Parameters:
      vectorParameter - parameter containing ScalarVector of population values
      Returns:
      the standard deviation equation

    • standardDeviation

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction standardDeviation​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, String variable)
      Return the equation to compute the standard deviation from a sample population 
      
     σy = √(Σ(yi - ȳ)2 / (n - 1))

     or simply, the square root of the variance function

     √σ2y
      Parameters:
      vector - parameter containing ScalarVector of population values
      variable - the variable to assign to the function
      Returns:
      the standard deviation equation

    • covariance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction covariance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorY)
      Returns the covariance between two data sets. 
           σXY = Σ((xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ)) / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vectorX - contains the ScalarVector of the independent (x) variable values
      vectorY - contains the ScalarVector of the dependent (y) variable values
      Returns:
      the covariance equation

    • covariance

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction covariance​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorY, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanY)
      Returns the covariance between two data sets. 
           σXY = Σ((xi - x̄)(yi - ȳ)) / (n - 1)
      Parameters:
      vectorX - contains the ScalarVector of the independent (x) variable values
      vectorY - contains the ScalarVector of the dependent (y) variable values
      meanX - the function reference to the mean coefficient for the independent (x) variable
      meanY - the function reference to the mean coefficient for the dependent(y) variable
      Returns:
      the covariance equation

    • slope

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slope​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction varianceX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction covariance)
      Returns the slope of regression line 
           α = σ2x / σXY
      Parameters:
      varianceX - the variance coefficient for the independent (x) variable obtained from variance(ScalarVector)
      covariance - the covariance of the independent (x) and dependent variables obtained from the covariance(ScalarVector, ScalarVector)
      Returns:
      the slope equation

    • intercept

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction intercept​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanY, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeFunction)
      Computes the y-intercept for a given set of two variables, x and y 
           β = ȳ - α * x̄
      Parameters:
      meanX - the vector containing values for the independent variable (x). Required to access the mean(ScalarVector) coefficient
      meanY - the vector containing values for the dependent variable (y). Required to access the mean(ScalarVector) coefficient
      slopeFunction - the slope coefficient obtained from slope(ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction)
      Returns:
      the intercept equation

    • residualSumOfSquares

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction residualSumOfSquares​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorY, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeCoefficient, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction interceptCoefficient)
      Returns the residual (sum of squares) between the predicted dependent variable value (ŷ) and the actual y value 
           SSR = Σ(ŷi - yi)2

     Where:

     ŷi = βxi + α
      Parameters:
      vectorX - vector containing the values for the independent variable (x)
      vectorY - vector containing the values for the dependent variable (y)
      slopeCoefficient - the slope coefficient obtained from the slope(ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction) equation
      interceptCoefficient - the intercept coefficient obtained from the intercept(ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction) equation
      Returns:
      the residual variance equation

    • totalSumOfSquares

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction totalSumOfSquares​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vector, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction mean)
      Returns the total variation between a variable's observed and mean values 
           SST = Σ(yi - ȳ)2
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector of values for a given variable
      mean - the mean of all values for the given variable. See mean(ScalarVector)
      Returns:
      the total variance equation

    • rSquared

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction rSquared​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction residualVarianceFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction totalVarianceFunction)
      Returns the goodness of fit of a regression model against two variables, x and y using the model's residualSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarVector, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction) and the dependent variable's totalSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarFunction) 
           R2 = 1 - (SSR / SST)
      Parameters:
      residualVarianceFunction - the residual variance coefficient, obtained from the residualSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarVector, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction) function
      totalVarianceFunction - the total variance coefficient, obtained from the totalSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarFunction) function
      Returns:
      the r-squared function

    • meanSquaredError

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanSquaredError​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorY, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction interceptFunction)
      Function calculating the mean standard error (MSE) for a given set of independent (x) and dependent (y) variables, using the equation: 

               MSE = Σ(ŷi - yi)2 / (n - 2)

     Where:

         ŷi = βxi + α

      Parameters:
      vectorX - the vector for the independent variable (x)
      vectorY - the vector for the dependent variable (y)
      slopeFunction - the slope function. See slope(ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction)
      interceptFunction - the intercept function. See intercept(ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction)
      Returns:
      the mean standard error function

    • slopeStandardError

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeStandardError​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction sumOfSquaresX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanSquaredError)
      Function to calculate the standard error for the slope, using the equation: 

              sβ = sqrt(MSE) / sqrt(SSx)

        Where:

        MSE (mean squared error) = Σ(ŷi - yi)2 / (n - 2)
        SSx (sum of squares of x) = Σ(xi - x̄)2

      Parameters:
      sumOfSquaresX - the sum of squares for the independent variable (x). See totalSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarFunction)
      meanSquaredError - the mean squared error. See meanSquaredError(ScalarVector, ScalarVector, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction)
      Returns:
      the slope standard error function

    • interceptStandardError

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction interceptStandardError​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanSquaredErrorFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction meanXFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction sumOfSquaresXFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.util.Scalar count)
      Function to calculate the standard error for the intercept, using the equation 

               sα = sqrt(MSE * ( 1/n + (x̄2 / SSx)))

         Where:
         MSE (mean squared error) = Σ(ŷi - yi)2 / (n - 2)
         SSx (sum of squares of x) = Σ(xi - x̄)2

      Parameters:
      meanSquaredErrorFunction - the mean squared error function. See meanSquaredError(ScalarVector, ScalarVector, ScalarFunction, ScalarFunction)
      meanXFunction - the mean of the independent variable (x). See mean(ScalarVector)
      sumOfSquaresXFunction - the sum of squares of the independent variable (x). See totalSumOfSquares(ScalarVector, ScalarFunction)
      count - the size of the total population
      Returns:
      the intercept standard error function

    • slopeTStatistic

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeTStatistic​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeFunction, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeStandardError)

    • slopePValue

      io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopePValue​(int degreesOfFreedom, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarFunction slopeTStatistic)

    • linearRegression

      LinearRegressionModel linearRegression​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.Matrix matrix)
      Create a linear regression model from a matrix of values. By default, the model will use the first column (0) as the independent variable (x), and the next column (1) as the dependent variable (y). Use linearRegression(Matrix, int, int) if you want to choose different columns
      Parameters:
      matrix - the matrix containing the data
      Returns:
      a linear regression model, solved for a given independent and dependent variable

    • linearRegression

      LinearRegressionModel linearRegression​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.Matrix matrix, int setX, int setY)
      Create a linear regression model from a matrix of values.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the matrix containing the data
      setX - the column index containing the values for the independent variable (x)
      setY - the column index containing the values for the dependent variable (y)
      Returns:
      a linear regression model, solved for a given independent and dependent variable

    • linearRegression

      LinearRegressionModel linearRegression​(io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorX, io.xmljim.algorithms.model.ScalarVector vectorY)
      Create a linear regression model for two sets of values, one for the independent variable (x), and another for the dependent variable (y)
      Parameters:
      vectorX - the data for the independent variable (x)
      vectorY - the data for the dependent variable (y)
      Returns:
      a linear regression model, solved for a given independent and dependent variable
